moves.1... c6: Matveeva decides against the Classical response.
moves.2. d3: Very conservative. The usual reply is to advance this Pawn TWO squares and form an ideal center.
moves.3. Nd2: Because of the timid second move, 3 N-QB3 is no longer possible, as 3... P-Q5 would drive the Knight from its post.
moves.3... Nf6: Matveeva develops the Knight to its natural square.
moves.4... Bg4: Matveeva develops aggressively, in contrast to Shafranska's overly timid approach.
moves.5. g3: I'm guessing this was intended as a prelude to fianchettoing the KB. However, it weakens the pinned Knight by depriving it of Pawn protection.
moves.5... dxe4: Matveeva exploits the error by adding pressure to the helpless Knight.
moves.6... Bxf3: ...this move now wins a piece. Shafranska resigns.
